page.title: 01An Introduction.
page.content: {Great Houghton}is in{South Yorkshire, approximately seven and a half miles from Barnsley.It is mainly a{farming and{mining}community . There are only two{schools}in Great Houghton, both of which are primary,taking pupils from 5 to 11 years of age.They are the Church Of England School and the Junior and Infant School. Primary children usually transfer to Darfield Foulstone High School for their{secondary education.}Great Houghton,along with other mining areas,is just recovering from the {miner's strike}that lasted from the beginning of March 1984 until the very end of February 1985.It could take up to 2 years to properly get over this. There is{woodland}surrounding the village,but many trees have been chopped down to provide fuel during the strike.
